meanings.sent1: The tree will rebranch after the storm damaged its limbs.
meanings.sent2: I hope the plant will rebranch and become even more beautiful.
meanings.sent3: When the tree decided to rebranch, the other trees cheered it on.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas began to rebranch, leading to new and exciting possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The river seemed to rebranch endlessly, creating a mesmerizing pattern.

meanings.sent1: With proper care, the plant will rebranch and flourish.
meanings.sent2: The tree will rebranch in the spring, filling the garden with greenery.
meanings.sent3: The idea to rebranch the project sparked enthusiasm among the team.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity seemed to rebranch infinitely, bringing forth new projects.
meanings.sent5: The company's success allowed it to rebranch into new markets.

meanings.definition: A new branch that grows from an existing one.
meanings.sent1: The rebranch on the tree showed signs of healthy growth.
meanings.sent2: I noticed a rebranch on the old oak tree in the backyard.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rebranch on the plant surprised the gardener.
meanings.sent4: The rebranch on the family tree revealed a long-lost relative.
meanings.sent5: The rebranch on the riverbank provided a perfect spot for fishing.
